cmd.name: FlatTrim
cmd.$t: Do a flat trim

cmd.name: TakeOff
cmd.$t: Ask the drone to take off

arg.name: flag
arg.$t: Boolean flag to activate roll/pitch movement

arg.name: timestampAndSeqNum
arg.$t: Command timestamp in milliseconds (low 24 bits) + command sequence number [0;255] (high 8 bits).

cmd.name: Landing
cmd.$t: Ask the drone to land

cmd.name: Emergency
cmd.$t: Put drone in emergency user state

arg.name: start
arg.$t: 1 to start the navigate home, 0 to stop it

arg.name: state
arg.$t: State of automatic take off mode (1 for autotake off enabled)

arg.name: dX
arg.$t: Wanted displacement along the front axis [m]

arg.name: dY
arg.$t: Wanted displacement along the right axis [m]

arg.name: dZ
arg.$t: Wanted displacement along the down axis [m]

arg.name: tilt
pan
mass_storage_id
arg.$t: Mass storage id to take picture

cmd.name: PictureV2
cmd.$t: Take picture

arg.name: state
arg.$t: 1 if picture has been taken, 0 otherwise

arg.name: mass_storage_id
arg.$t: Mass storage id where the picture was recorded

arg.name: mass_storage_id
arg.$t: Mass storage id where the video was recorded

enum.name: notAvailable
enum.$t: The picture recording is not available

enum.name: camera_ko
enum.$t: Picture camera is out of order

enum.name: memoryFull
enum.$t: Memory full ; cannot save one additional picture

enum.name: lowBattery
enum.$t: Battery is too low to start/keep recording.

enum.name: notAvailable
enum.$t: The video recording is not available

enum.name: camera_ko
enum.$t: Video camera is out of order

enum.name: memoryFull
enum.$t: Memory full ; cannot save one additional video

enum.name: lowBattery
enum.$t: Battery is too low to start/keep recording.

enum.name: unknown
enum.$t: Unknown generic error ; only when state is failed

enum.name: busy
enum.$t: Picture recording is busy ; only when state is failed

enum.name: notAvailable
enum.$t: Picture recording not available ; only when state is failed

enum.name: memoryFull
enum.$t: Memory full ; only when state is failed

enum.name: lowBattery
enum.$t: Battery is too low to record.

enum.name: unknown
enum.$t: Unknown generic error ; only when state is failed

enum.name: busy
enum.$t: Video recording is busy ; only when state is failed

enum.name: notAvailable
enum.$t: Video recording not available ; only when state is failed

enum.name: lowBattery
enum.$t: Battery is too low to record.

cmd.name: FlatTrimChanged
cmd.$t: Drone acknowledges that flat trim was correctly processed

enum.name: too_much_angle
enum.$t: The angle of the drone is too high

enum.name: pending
enum.$t: Navigate home has been received, but its process is pending

enum.name: connectionLost
enum.$t: Connection between controller and product lost (available->inProgress)

enum.name: disabled
enum.$t: Navigate home disabled by product (inProgress->unavailable or available->unavailable)

arg.name: latitude
arg.$t: Latitude position in decimal degrees (500.0 if not available)

arg.name: longitude
arg.$t: Longitude position in decimal degrees (500.0 if not available)

arg.name: speedX
arg.$t: Speed on the x axis (when drone moves forward, speed is > 0) (in m/s)

arg.name: speedY
arg.$t: Speed on the y axis (when drone moves to right, speed is > 0) (in m/s)

arg.name: speedZ
arg.$t: Speed on the z axis (when drone moves down, speed is > 0) (in m/s)

arg.name: state
arg.$t: State of automatic take off mode (1 if enabled)

arg.name: dX
arg.$t: Distance traveled along the front axis [m]

arg.name: dY
arg.$t: Distance traveled along the right axis [m]

arg.name: dZ
arg.$t: Distance traveled along the down axis [m]

enum.name: busy
enum.$t: The Device is busy ; command moveBy ignored

enum.name: notAvailable
enum.$t: Command moveBy is not available ; command moveBy ignored

cmd.name: WifiAuthChannel
cmd.$t: Controller inquire the list of authorized wifi channels.

arg.name: rssi
arg.$t: RSSI of the AP in dbm (negative value)

cmd.name: AllWifiScanChanged
cmd.$t: State sent when all scanning result sent

arg.name: in_or_out
arg.$t: Bit 0 is 1 if channel is authorized outside (0 otherwise) ; Bit 1 is 1 if channel is authorized inside (0 otherwise)

cmd.name: AllWifiAuthChannelChanged
cmd.$t: Notify the end of the list of Authorized wifi Channel.

arg.name: shouldNotFlyOver
arg.$t: 1 if the drone can't fly further than max distance, 0 if no limitation on the drone should be done

arg.name: shouldNotFlyOver
arg.$t: 1 if the drone won't fly further than max distance, 0 if no limitation on the drone will be done

arg.name: current
arg.$t: Current max vertical speed in m/s

arg.name: current
arg.$t: Current max rotation speed in degree/s

arg.name: outdoor
arg.$t: 1 if outdoor flight, 0 if indoor flight

arg.name: current
arg.$t: Current max vertical speed in m/s

arg.name: current
arg.$t: Current max rotation speed in degree/s

arg.name: outdoor
arg.$t: 1 if outdoor flight, 0 if indoor flight

arg.name: channel
arg.$t: The channel (not used in auto mode)

enum.name: open
enum.$t: Wifi is not protected by any security (default)

arg.name: key
arg.$t: The key to secure the network (empty if type is open)

enum.name: plain
enum.$t: Key is plain text, not encrypted

enum.name: open
enum.$t: Wifi is not protected by any security (default)

arg.name: motorIds
arg.$t: Bit field for concerned motor. If bit 0 = 1, motor 1 is affected by this error. Same with bit 1, 2 and 3.

enum.name: errorCommLost
enum.$t: Communication with motor failed by timeout

enum.name: errorRealTime
enum.$t: Motor controler scheduler real-time out of bounds

enum.name: errorMotorSetting
enum.$t: One or several incorrect values in motor settings

enum.name: errorTemperature
enum.$t: Too hot or too cold Cypress temperature

enum.name: errorMOSFET
enum.$t: Defectuous MOSFET or broken motor phases

enum.name: errorBootloader
enum.$t: Not use for BLDC but useful for HAL

arg.name: version
arg.$t: name of the version : dot separated fields (major version - minor version - firmware type - nb motors handled). Firmware types : Release, Debug, Alpha, Test-bench

arg.name: lastFlightDuration
arg.$t: Duration of the last flight (in seconds)

enum.name: errorCommLost
enum.$t: Communication with motor failed by timeout

enum.name: errorRealTime
enum.$t: Motor controler scheduler real-time out of bounds

enum.$t: Defectuous MOSFET or broken motor phases

enum.name: errorTemperature
enum.$t: Too hot or too cold Cypress temperature

enum.name: errorBootloader
enum.$t: Not use for BLDC but useful for HAL

enum.name: auto
enum.$t: Auto guess of best white balance params

arg.name: value
arg.$t: Exposition value (bounds given by ExpositionChanged arg min and max, by default [-3:3])

arg.name: value
arg.$t: Saturation value (bounds given by SaturationChanged arg min and max, by default [-100:100])

arg.name: interval
arg.$t: interval in seconds for taking pictures

arg.name: enabled
arg.$t: 1 if video autorecord is enabled, 0 otherwise

cmd.name: ResetHome
cmd.$t: Reset home location and let the drone make its own home

arg.name: horizontalAccuracy
arg.$t: Horizontal Accuracy in meter ; equal -1 if no horizontal Accuracy

arg.name: verticalAccuracy
arg.$t: Vertical Accuracy in meter ; equal -1 if no vertical Accuracy

enum.name: TAKEOFF

arg.$t: 1 if gps on drone is fixed, 0 otherwise

enum.name: fiftyHertz
enum.$t: Electric frequency of the country is 50hz

enum.name: sixtyHertz
enum.$t: Electric frequency of the country is 60hz

enum.name: auto
enum.$t: Anti flickering based on the electric frequency previously sent

enum.name: FixedFiftyHertz
enum.$t: Anti flickering based on a fixed frequency of 50Hz

enum.$t: Anti flickering based on a fixed frequency of 60Hz

enum.$t: Anti flickering based on a fixed frequency of 60Hz

enum.$t: The drone will try to return to the take off position

arg.$t: 1 if this type is available, 0 otherwise

cmd.name: Disconnect
cmd.$t:
Signals the remote that the host will disconnect and close its
            libARNetwork instance (and all threads that use libARNetwork)

enum.name: off_button
enum.$t: The button off has been pressed

cmd.name: AllSettings
cmd.$t: Get all product settings, the product must send all settings

cmd.name: Reset
cmd.$t: Reset all settings

cmd.name: AllSettingsChanged
cmd.$t: State sent when all settings has been sent.

cmd.name: ResetChanged
cmd.$t: State sent when all settings has been resetting.

arg.name: code
arg.$t: Country code with ISO 3166 format, empty string means unknown country.

cmd.name: AllStates
cmd.$t: Get all product states.

cmd.name: Reboot
cmd.$t: Command to ask reboot to product

cmd.name: AllStatesChanged
cmd.$t: State sent when all product states has been sent.

arg.name: used_size
arg.$t: Mass storage used size in MBytes

arg.name: plugged
arg.$t: Mass storage plugged (1 if mass storage is plugged, otherwise 0)

arg.name: full
arg.$t: Mass storage full information state (1 if mass storage full, 0 otherwise).

arg.name: internal
arg.$t: Mass storage internal type state (1 if mass storage is internal, 0 otherwise)

arg.name: free_space
arg.$t: Mass storage free space in MBytes

arg.name: rec_time
arg.$t: Mass storage record time reamining in minute

arg.name: rssi
arg.$t: RSSI of the signal between controller and the product (in dbm)

arg.name: sensorState
arg.$t: Sensor state (1 if the sensor is OK, 0 if the sensor is NOT OK)

arg.name: listFlags
arg.$t:
List entry attribute Bitfield.
                0x01: First: indicate it's the first element of the list. 
                0x02: Last:  indicate it's the last element of the list.
                0x04: Empty: indicate the list is empty (implies First/Last). All other arguments should be ignored.

arg.name: countryCodes
arg.$t: Following of country code with ISO 3166 format, separated by ";". Be careful of the command size allowed by the network used. If necessary, split the list in several commands.

cmd.name: SwitchOff
cmd.$t:
@deprecated
            Switch off the drone when a overheat appeared

cmd.name: Ventilate
cmd.$t:
@deprecated
            Ventilate the drone when a overheat appeared

cmd.name: OverHeatChanged
cmd.$t: Overheat temperature reached

arg.name: regulationType
arg.$t: Type of overheat regulation : 0 for ventilation, 1 for switch off

arg.name: piloting
arg.$t: 0 when the application is not in the piloting HUD, 1 when it enters the HUD.

arg.name: outdoor
arg.$t: 1 if it should use outdoor wifi settings, 0 otherwise

arg.name: outdoor
arg.$t: 1 if it should use outdoor wifi settings, 0 otherwise

arg.name: filepath
arg.$t: flight plan file path from the mavlink ftp root

cmd.name: Pause
cmd.$t: Pause the flightplan (can be restarted with a start)

cmd.name: Stop
cmd.$t: Stop the flightplan

enum.name: stopped
enum.$t: Mavlink file is stopped (arg filepath and type are useless in this state)

arg.name: filepath
arg.$t: flight plan file path from the mavlink ftp root

enum.name: notInOutDoorMode
enum.$t: The drone is not in outdoor mode

enum.name: notCalibrated
enum.$t: The magnetometer of the drone is not calibrated

arg.name: calibrate
arg.$t: 1 if the calibration should be started, 0 if it should be aborted

arg.name: xAxisCalibration
arg.$t: State of the x axis (roll) calibration : 1 if calibration is done, 0 otherwise

arg.name: yAxisCalibration
arg.$t: State of the y axis (pitch) calibration : 1 if calibration is done, 0 otherwise

arg.name: zAxisCalibration
arg.$t: State of the z axis (yaw) calibration : 1 if calibration is done, 0 otherwise

arg.name: calibrationFailed
arg.$t: 1 if calibration has failed, 0 otherwise. If this arg is 1, consider all previous arg as 0

arg.name: required
arg.$t: 1 if calibration is required, 0 if current calibration is still valid

enum.name: xAxis
enum.$t: If the current calibration axis should be the x axis

enum.name: yAxis
enum.$t: If the current calibration axis should be the y axis

enum.name: zAxis
enum.$t: If the current calibration axis should be the z axis

enum.name: none
enum.$t: If none of the axis should be calibrated

arg.name: fov
arg.$t: Value of the camera horizontal fov (in degree)

arg.name: panMax
arg.$t: Value of max pan (right pan) (in degree)

arg.name: panMin
arg.$t: Value of min pan (left pan) (in degree)

arg.name: tiltMax
arg.$t: Value of max tilt (top tilt) (in degree)

arg.name: tiltMin
arg.$t: Value of min tilt (bottom tilt) (in degree)

arg.name: AvailabilityState
arg.$t: Running a flightPlan file is available (1 running a flightPlan file is available, otherwise 0)

arg.name: State
arg.$t: State of the FlightPlan component (1 FlightPlan component OK, otherwise 0)

cmd.name: StartingErrorEvent
cmd.$t: Event of flight plan start error

cmd.name: SpeedBridleEvent
cmd.$t: Bridle speed of the drone

arg.name: ready
running
arg.$t:
Bit field for TX and RX running
                bit 0 is 1 if Drone TX is running
                bit 1 is 1 if Drone RX is running

arg.name: left
arg.$t: Set the left LED intensity value (0 through 255).

arg.name: right
arg.$t: Set the right LED intensity value (0 through 255).

arg.name: left
arg.$t: The intensity value for the left LED (0 through 255).

arg.name: right
arg.$t: The intensity value for the right LED (0 through 255).

enum.name: SPIN_TO_POSTURE
enum.$t: Spin that end in standing posture, or in jumper if it was standing animation.

enum.name: SPIN_TO_POSTURE
enum.$t: Spin that end in standing posture, or in jumper if it was standing animation.

cmd.name: StopAllAnimations
cmd.$t: Stop all running animations.

enum.name: SPIN_TO_POSTURE
enum.$t: Spin that end in standing posture, or in jumper if it was standing animation.

enum.name: UNCONFIGURED
enum.$t: No accessory configuration set. Controller needs to set one.

enum.name: OK
enum.$t: No error. Accessory config change successful.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.$t: Cannot change accessory configuration for some reason.

enum.name: FLYING
enum.$t: Cannot change accessory configuration while flying.

arg.name: enabled
arg.$t: 1 if the modification of the accessory Config is enabled, 0 otherwise

enum.name: SLOW
enum.$t: Fully charge the battery at a slow rate. Typically limit max charge current to 512 mA.

enum.name: MODERATE
enum.$t: Almost fully-charge the battery at moderate rate (> 512mA) but slower than the fastest rate.

enum.name: FAST
enum.$t: Almost fully-charge the battery at the highest possible rate supported by the charger.

enum.name: SLOW
enum.$t: Fully charge the battery at a slow rate. Typically limit max charge current to 512 mA.

enum.name: MODERATE
enum.$t: Almost fully-charge the battery at moderate rate (> 512 mA) but slower than the fastest rate.

enum.name: FAST
enum.$t: Almost fully-charge the battery at the highest possible rate supported by the charger.

enum.name: CHARGING_SLOW
enum.$t: The battery is charging at a slow rate about 512 mA.

enum.name: CHARGING_MODERATE
enum.$t: The battery is charging at a moderate rate (> 512 mA) but slower than the fastest rate.

enum.name: CHARGING_FAST
enum.$t: The battery is charging at a the fastest rate.

enum.name: BATTERY_FULL
enum.$t: The charger is plugged and the battery is fully charged.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.$t: The charge phase is unknown or irrelevant.

enum.name: CONSTANT_CURRENT_1
enum.$t: First phase of the charging process. The battery is charging with constant current.

enum.name: CONSTANT_CURRENT_2
enum.$t: Second phase of the charging process. The battery is charging with constant current, with a higher voltage than the first phase.

enum.name: CONSTANT_VOLTAGE
enum.$t: Last part of the charging process. The battery is charging with a constant voltage.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.$t: The last charge rate is not known.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.$t: The charge phase is unknown or irrelevant.

enum.name: CONSTANT_CURRENT_1
enum.$t: First phase of the charging process. The battery is charging with constant current.

enum.name: CONSTANT_CURRENT_2
enum.$t: Second phase of the charging process. The battery is charging with constant current, with a higher voltage than the first phase.

enum.name: CONSTANT_VOLTAGE
enum.$t: Last part of the charging process. The battery is charging with a constant voltage.

enum.name: DISCHARGING
enum.$t: The battery is discharging; Other arguments refers to the last charge.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.$t: The charge rate is not known.

arg.name: intensity
arg.$t: The charging intensity, in dA. (12dA = 1,2A) ; If phase is DISCHARGING, refers to the last charge. Equals to 0 if not known.

arg.name: fullChargingTime
arg.$t: The full charging time estimated, in minute. If phase is DISCHARGING, refers to the last charge. Equals to 0 if not known.
